name: Holdout Blaster
description: These blasters were produced for Imperial agents, having an increased range over other holdouts although with reduced damage. The specifications were stolen and the black market was flooded with the weapon.
details: When an individual is attempting to find the concealed weapon, add one setback die to the roll.
reference: Please see page 161 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 174 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 167 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: TT24 Holdout Blaster
description: These blasters are exceptionally small pistols which are easily portable and hidden away. For this reason they have a decreased range.
details: When an individual is attempting to find the concealed weapon, add one setback die to the roll.
reference: Please see page 26 of the Beyond the Rim Adventure Module for details.

name: Military Holdout Blaster
description: This small personal blaster is designed to be easily drawn, but also to blend in with one's clothing. Favoured among diplomats that may come across aggressive agents.
details: Add 1 setback die to Perception checks to find the blaster. The weapon may run out of ammunition upon 3 Threat results.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to find this weapon on a body.
Can run out of ammo by spending [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT].

name: Variable Holdout Blaster
description: A unique, locally produced holdout blaster manufactured on Ord Gimmel, the variable holdout blaster can switch between seven different power levels, potentially putting it on par with military holdout blasters.
details: When firing the weapon, the pistol's wielder must choose a power setting between 1 and 7. This is the amount of damage a successful shot inflicts on a target, but it's also the amount of ammo that is consumed for the shot. If set to a power setting higher than the available ammo left, the weapon deals damage equal to the amount of ammo remaining. Add one Black Setback Die to a character's Perception checks when attempting to find a variable holdout blaster on a person's body.
reference: Please see page 104 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Anyone searching an individual carrying a concealed variable holdout blaster adds [SETBACK] to their Perception checks.
Wielder must choose a power setting between 1 and 7.  This is the amount of damage a successful shot will inflict, and is also the amount of ammo expended.

name: Model Q4 Quickfire
description: This unique holdout blaster uses a specialised power-pack that allows for a greater output than other houldouts. However, the pack cannot be replaced and must be recharged from a power-source.
details: Add 1 setback dice to Perception checks when attempting to find the concealed weapon. If the weapon runs out of ammo due to a despair result, cannot be reloaded. Must take 10 minutes with a power-source to recharge it instead.
reference: Please see page 40 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to find this weapon on a body.  May not be reloaded.

name: 12 Defender
description: This holdout blaster is described as a "micro blaster", one of the smallest blasters in the galaxy. It is designed for self-defense and concealment. They also typically lack distinguishing markings, making them hard to track.
details: Add 2 setback dice to Computers and Perception checks to find the concealed weapon. May not be reloaded.
reference: Please see page 40 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to Perception and Computers checks to find this weapon on a body.  May not be reloaded.

name: Defender Sporting Blaster Pistol
description: This pistol is commonly used by the Corporate Sector Authority, but is popular enough that it is often seen among the nobility and aristocracy.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

name: ELG-3A Blaster Pistol
description: A crossover weapon that occupied a unique niche between holdout blaster and light blaster pistol, the elegant ELG-3A is a SoroSuub Corporation design marketed to politicians and the wealthy, who demand both form and function.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to Perception checks to find this weapon on a body.

name: Light Blaster Pistol
description: This is an example of the superior craftsmanship of Coronet Arms, balancing discretion and firepower in a tight package.
reference: Please see page 161 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 174 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 167 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: HL-27 Light Blaster Pistol
description: This is an example of the superior craftsmanship of Coronet Arms, balancing discretion and firepower in a tight package.
reference: Please see page 94 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Pocket Blaster Pistol
description: Manufactured on Talus and Tralus by Fed-Dub Protective Services, the Spukami is sold throughout the Corellian system as a home-defense weapon.
details: When firing the Spukami at short range (or longer) the weapon gains the Inaccurate 1 quality. It does not gain this quality when fired at an engaged target. Add one setback die to a character's Perception checks when attempting to find a Spukami on a person's body.
reference: Please see page 96 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Blaster Pistol
description: The ubiquitous blaster pistol is the standard by which energy-based sidearms are measured throughout the galaxy.
reference: Please see page 161 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 174 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 167 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: CDEF Blaster Pistol
description: These pistols are a standard issue to CorSec officers by the CEC. They are relatively cheap and a basic design.
reference: Please see page 94 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Relby-K23 Blaster Pistol
description: Known for its low refraction index, which resulted in minimal beam dispersion when the blaster was fired. The beam produced by this blaster pistol inflicted excruciating pain upon beings who had the misfortune of being hit by it.
reference: Please see page 12 of The Jewel of Yavin Adventure Module for details.

name: Dueling Pistol
description: An ornate, long-bodied blaster pistol of impeccable craftsmanship, the Coronet Arms model is typical of dueling blasters, often custom ordered in pairs.
reference: Please see page 94 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: XL-2 "Flashfire" Blaster Pistol
description: The engineers at Talus Ironworks in the Corellian system created the XL-2 by accident when they test-fired a prototype with a faulty focusing aperture.
reference: Please see page 95 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: H-7 "Equalizer" Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 95 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.
description: Considered a masterpiece of the blaster pistol design, Coronet Arms' H-7 "Equalizer" is a precision-tuned blaster pistol that is thought of as both a work of art and a functional weapon.

name: DR-45 "Dragoon" Cavalry Blaster
details: Converting the DR-45 from a pistol to a carbine takes one maneuver and changes the weapon's combat skill from Ranged - Light to Ranged - Heavy. Similarly, it takes one maneuver to convert the weapon back, restoring its combat skill to Ranged - Light.
reference: Please see page 40 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.
description: The DR-45 "Dragoon" Cavalry Blaster has its origins in the popular Merr-Sonn Munitions DD6 blaster pistol.

name: Boonta Blaster
details: Characters add one Black Setback die to Perception checks to realize a scepter is a Boonta Blaster. Remove one Black Setback die from the wearer's Deception checks to explain away the weapon as purely ornamental or otherwise nonthreatening.
reference: Please see page 100 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to find a Boonta Blaster on a wearer's body.
Remove [SETBACK] from the wearer's Deception checks to explain away the Boonta Blaster as purely ornamental or otherwise non-threatening.

description: A Huttese weapon of sinister design, the Boonta Blaster is named for the infamous, deified Hutt who allegedly commissioned the first one: Boonta Hestilic Shad'ruu.

name: Greff-Timms ATA Pulse-Wave Blaster
description: Considered state-of-the-art thousands of years ago, the ATA pulse-wave blaster is a short-range plasma disruptor pistol that functions on the same basic principles as a modern blaster.
reference: Please see page 100 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

name: Heavy Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 162 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 174 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 167 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Occupying a niche similar to that of the BlasTech T-6 "Thunderer" and C-10 "Dragoneye Reaper" Heavy Blaster Pistol, SoroSuub Corporation's "Renegade" heavy blaster pistol features the highest energy output of any SoroSuub-model blaster pistol.

name: Security S-5 Heavy Blaster Pistol
description: Also known as an ascension gun, SoroSuub's oversized "Security" S-5 heavy blaster pistol features a versatile under-barrel dart launcher that fires a grappling hook.
details: As an action, a character may make an Average (2 Difficulty) Ranged - Light check to secure the grappling hook to an object within medium range. If the check is successful, on a subsequent turn as an action, they may reel in the cord, pulling themselves to the object (or, if the object is unsecured and lighter than they are, pulling it to them).
reference: Please see page 43 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Character may make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check[b] to secure the grappling hook to an object within medium range. An [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Athletics check[b] may be used to carry another character with him.

name: KO-2 Heavy Stun Pistol
reference: Please see page 42 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: The Palandrix KO-2 heavy stun pistol is a favored weapon of law enforcement agencies throughout the Core Worlds.

name: Model 44 Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 41 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: This is an iconic blaster pistol, considered reliable and more than adequate for most situations. It is often used by those on starship due to its low power.

name: Model 80 Blaster Pistol
details: The time taken to draw, holster, stow, or otherwise access this weapon cannot be reduced by talents, gear, or any other means.
reference: Please see page 41 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Time taken to access this weapon cannot be reduced by talents, gear, or other means.

description: Merr-Sonn Munitions' Model 80 Blaster Pistol is an old standby for planetary defense forces, militias, and mercenary units.

name: IR-5 "Intimidator" Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 41 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: Merr-Sonn's entry into the repeating blaster pistol market is among the larger weapons in its class, and its range is among the best.

name: CR-2 Heavy Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 96 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.
description: This relatively outdated weapon is no longer in production, but seen all over the galaxy, used by police security officers. It is often equipped with a fore-grip for easier use.

name: Site-145 Replica Blaster Pistol
details: The Site-145 replica blaster pistol automatically features the Force-Attuned Resonator weapon attachment.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.      [P][I]The HP for this weapon should be used to attach a Force-attuned resonator attachment only.[i]
description: Though the Jedi Order was primarily known for its use of lightsabers, there have been countless other Force traditions throughout the galaxy's long and murky history, and many fought with other weapons.

name: x-30 Lancer
reference: Please see page 38 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: DL-19C Blaster Pistol
details: When a character applies the Jury Rigged talent to this weapon, they may select one additional option from the talent's list and apply it to the weapon. The character cannot select the same option twice.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.
description: While most weapons engineers strive for power, accuracy, capacity, and durability from blaster designs, BlasTech's DL-19C design team chose to elevate customization above all else.

name: DL-7h Heavy Blaster Pistol
details: May run out of ammo with 2 disadvantage results.
reference: Please see page 41 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [THREAT][THREAT] may cause weapon to run out of ammo.

description: This heavy pistol can do a decent amount of damage, in a package similar to a basic pistol, but the cost for this damage is that it often drains through its power cell quickly.

name: HH-50 Heavy Blaster Pistol
details: Rolling 2 disadvantages may cause the weapon to run out of ammunition. Rolling 3 disadvantages may cause the weapon to overheat.
reference: Please see page 41 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.
description: This rather large blaster pistol is built from a variety of parts used in the DC-15 clone trooper blaster carbine. It is double-barreled and includes a set of patented systems.

name: SE-14C Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 42 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.
description: Of all standard issue Imperial blasters, few pack as much bang per credit as the SE-14C blaster pistol.

name: Mon Calamari Battle Baton
reference: Please see page 105 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: The Mon Calamari battle baton is a simple energy weapon in the shape of a ribbed scepter.

name: Energy Slingshot
details: Triggering the Disorient quality on this weapon requires one Advantage result instead of two Advantage results.
reference: Please see page 102 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Triggering the Disorient quality requires [AD] instead of [AD][AD].

description: Less a weapon than a tool for mischievous pranksters, the energy slingshot is a wrist-mounted device.

name: Blaster Carbine
reference: Please see page 162 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 175 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 168 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: This blaster can be used one-handed at short range just as a pistol, but packing the punch of a rifle. They are shorter and generally less accurate or ranged than a rifle.

name: Geonosian Blaster Carbine
reference: Please see page 33 of the Long Arm of the Hutt Bonus Adventure for details.

name: OK-98 Blaster Carbine
details: A character using an OK-98 can ignore the first "out of ammo" Despair result during a combat, just as if they had an extra reload, without expending a maneuver. Modifying an OK-98 increases its damage by two, replacing the option to ignore the first "out of ammo" result. The GM can spend a Despair result to have a modified OK-98 catastrophically overheat and explode, inflicting one hit from the weapon (dealing base damage) on the user and destroying the weapon after the attack has been resolved.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May ignore first [DESPAIR] "out of ammo" during combat, or may modify with [B]Easy ([DIFFICULTY]) Mechanics check[b] to add +2 damage.  Modded weapon may explode with [DESPAIR].

description: A unique SoroSuub design featuring twin power packs to double ammunition capacity, the OK-98 sold poorly even though it performed adequately.

name: E5 Blaster Carbine
details: GMs may spend three Threat or a Despair to force the E5 to overheat and damage itself one step.
reference: Please see page 41 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.
description: Millions of E5 blaster carbines litter the battlefields of the Clone Wars and are still salvaged today.

name: Bola Carbine
reference: Please see page 104 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: Individually handcrafted, the bola carbine is a unique energy weapon that ensnares and trips up targets.

name: DLS-12 Heavy Blaster Carbine
reference: Please see page 42 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: Designed for the Republic during the final months of the Clone Wars, BlasTech's DLS-12 is a carbine version of the DLT-19 heavy blaster rifle.

name: DH-17 Blaster Carbine
reference: Please see page 43 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.
description: BlasTech's popular DH-17 blaster pistol spawned an entire line of weapons after landing large contracts with the Empire and thousands of planetary security forces.

name: GALAAR-15 Blaster Carbine
reference: Please see page 36 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.
description: The GALAAR-15 is a popular blaster carbine built by Mandalorian arms giant Concordian Crescent Technologies.

name: Blaster Rifle
reference: Please see page 162 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 175 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 168 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: For nearly a century, the A280C heavy blaster rifle has been one of BlasTech's top-selling combat rifles.
details: Characters may reduce the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a BlasTech A280C heavy blaster rifle by 1

name: Geonosian Blaster Rifle
reference: Please see page 33 of the Long Arm of the Hutt Bonus Adventure for details.

name: SKZ Sporting Blaster Rifle
reference: Please see page 96 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Weequay Blaster Lance
reference: Please see page 100 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: Long-barreled blaster rifles designed for use in endless desert wastelands, blaster lances favor range and accuracy above all else..

name: Pulse Cannon
details: As a maneuver, a character wielding a pulse cannon may prime the weapon to expend all of its ammunition in a single, devastating shot. The next time the weapon is fired that encounter, it counts as having the Breach 1 and Vicious 3 qualities. After being discharged this way, the weapon runs out of ammunition.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As a maneuver, a character wielding a pulse cannon may prime the weapon to expend all of its ammunition in a single, devastating shot. The next time the weapon is fired this encounter, it counts as having the Breach 1 and Vicious 3 qualities. After being discharged this way, the weapon runs out of ammunition.

description: The typical pulse cannon features a fixed buttstock and dramatically elongated barrel.

name: DDC-MR6 Modular Rifle
details: A character may make an Average (2 Difficulty) Mechanics Check to add or remove an attachment to a DDC-MR6 as an action rather than spending the usual time required to remove an attachment.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A character may make an [B]Average([DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to add or remove an attachment to a DDC-MR6 as an action.

description: A modular rifle that the Drearian Defense Conglomerate designed for the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars, the MR6 comes with an electromagnetic rail system that enables the user to reconfigure quickly for different situations.

name: ACP Repeater Gun
reference: Please see page 100 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: Known as the Trandoshan chopper among mercenaries and slavers, and the Nar Shaddaa Grinder among Gank Killers, the ACP repeater was designed by Arakyd Industries for local planetary defense forces prior to the Clone Wars.

name: ACP Array Gun
reference: Please see page 42 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: SWE/2 Sonic Rifle
reference: Please see page 40 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: A riot-control sonic rifle from Telex-Delcor following up on the Clone Wars-era SWE/1 design, the SWE/2 can incapacitate even the toughest, most persistent malcontent.

name: Heavy Blaster Rifle
reference: Please see page 162 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 176 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: For nearly a century, the A280C heavy blaster rifle has been one of BlasTech's top-selling combat rifles.
details: Characters may reduce the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a BlasTech A280C heavy blaster rifle by 1.

name: DH-X Heavy Blaster Rifle
reference: Please see page 43 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: One of BlasTech's heaviest rifles, the DH-X heavy blaster rifle is designed to punch smashball-sized holes through any target in sight.

name: A280 Heavy Blaster Rifle
details: Characters may reduce the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a BlasTech A280C heavy blaster rifle by 1.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduce the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a BlasTech A280 heavy blaster rifle by 1.

name: E-11S Sniper Rifle
reference: Please see page 38 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: BlasTech's E-11 platform is one of the most successful blaster designs in recent history.

name: LBR-9 Stun Rifle
reference: Please see page 39 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: The LBR-9 stun rifle is a long-range stun blaster intended as a sniper weapon for law enforcement and intelligence agencies.

name: M-300 Hunting Blaster
details: Reduce the difficulty of combat checks made with this weapon by one against targets at long or extreme range.
reference: Please see page 40 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduce the difficulty of combat checks made with this weapon by one against targets at long or extreme range.

description: Offering unparalleled range for a stun rifle, BlasTech's M-300 hunting blaster comes in a small, lightweight, nearly indestructible frame wrapped in weather-sealed polycarbonate.

name: CR-8 Takedown Rifle
details: When a CR-8 is properly broken-down and concealed, add two Black Setback dice to a character's Perception checks made to find it on a person's body.
reference: Please see page 40 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When CR-8 is properly broken down and concealed, add [SE][SE] to Perception checks made to find it on a person.

description: The CR-8 is a high-performance blaster rifle designed for use by CorSec snipers and secret agents.

name: Nightsister Energy Bow
details: It can be folded and hidden away for easy concealment.
reference: Please see page 40 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

name: Light Repeating Blaster
reference: Please see page 162 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 176 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Known as the Imperial Repeating Pistol, this weapon is often carried by some imperial officers and pilots. It has a high fire rate and is military weaponry, meaning it will fetch a high price on the black market.

name: SE-14r Light Repeating Blaster
reference: Please see page 43 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT] may cause out of ammo.

description: Known as the Imperial Repeating Pistol, this weapon is often carried by some imperial officers and pilots. It has a high fire rate and is military weaponry, meaning it will fetch a high price on the black market.

name: SHUKUR-05 Light Repeater
reference: Please see page 49 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.

name: Heavy Repeating Blaster
reference: Please see page 162 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 176 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Heavy repeating blasters are among the heaviest portable weapons deployed on the galaxy's battlefields.

name: VX "Sidewinder" Repeating Blaster
reference: Please see page 43 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: Unlike other repeating blasters, the SoroSuub VX achieves its high rate of fire through the use of five rotating barrels.

name: HOB Heavy Repeating Blaster
details: The price of this weapon includes the price of a tripod and power pack. Setting up this tripod weapon requires the crew to spend two preparation maneuvers, plus two more for the tripod. Mechanics checks to repair a HOB gain one Advantage.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Mechanics Checks to repair gain [BOOST].

description: The HOB, or high-output repeating blaster, is the SoroSuub Corporation's attempt to loosen BlasTech's and Merr-Sonn's strangleholds on the heavy repeater market.

name: Z-6 Rotary Blaster Cannon
details: This weapon can only be used with its Auto-Fire item quality active. The GM may spend a Despair result or two Threat results from any combat check made with this weapon to have it overheat. When the weapon overheats, the wielder suffers 2 strain, and the weapon becomes damaged one step, from undamaged to minor, minor to moderate, or moderate to major.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: This weapon can only be used in Auto-fire mode.

The GM may spend [DE] or [TH][TH] from any combat check made with this weapon to have it overheat; the wielder suffers 2 strain and the weapon becomes damaged one step: from undamaged to Minor, Minor to Moderate, or Moderate to Major.

description: The Z-6 rotary blaster cannon is an exceptionally potent heavy squad support weapon built for the GAR by BlasTech.

name: J-10 Dual Blaster Cannon
details: The GM can spend two Threat or a Despair from any combat check made with this weapon to have it overheat. The wielder suffers 2 strain and the weapon becomes damaged one step.
reference: Please see page 45 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: The GM may spend [DE] or [TH][TH] from any combat check made with this weapon to have it overheat; the wielder suffers 2 strain and the weapon becomes damaged one step: from undamaged to Minor, Minor to Moderate, or Moderate to Major.

description: Originally a Separatist design from the Clone Wars, the J-10 is essentially a scaled-up pair of reciprocating E-5 blaster rifles.

name: Reciprocating Quad Blaster Cannon
details: This weapon can only be used in Auto-Fire mode. The GM may spend a Despair result or four Threat results from a combat check with this weapon to have the wielder suffer a Critical Injury with -50 to the roll, to a minimum of 1.
reference: Please see page 45 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: This weapon can only be used in Auto-fire mode.
The GM may spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH][TH] from a combat check with this weapon to have the wielder suffer a Critical injury with -50 to the roll, to a minimum of 1.

description: What is essentially a downscaled version of an anti-starfighter emplacement, the reciprocating quad blaster cannon is the heaviest personal weapon in Merr-Sonn Munitions' entire arsenal.

name: D-29 Repulsor Rifle
reference: Please see page 102 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: Repulsor weapons use ubiquitous repulsor engines, similar to those found on landspeeders and speeder bikes, tuned to create narrower, longer-range areas of effect..

name: Electromag-Pulse Disruptor
details: Add two Blue Boost dice to any check the character makes to sabotage electronics or computers. Add a Black Setback die to a character's Perception checks made to find this weapon on a person's body.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BO][BO] to any check made to sabotage electronics or computers.
Add [SE] to Perception checks made to find this weapon on a person's body.

description: An electromag-pulse disruptor is a slim stylus used to short out electronic equipment.

name: Bowcaster
details: Requires the user to spend a maneuver cocking the weapon before each shot.
reference: Please see page 162 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Well known as the traditional weapon of the Wookiees of Kashyyyk, bowcasters, also called laser crossbows, magnetically accelerate metal quarrels encased in a plasma energy sheath.

name: Kyuzo Energy Bow
reference: Please see page 44 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.
description: Designed to be fired from a mount or mobile platform, a Kyuzo energy bow is a massive bow that fires terrifyingly large, charged bolts.

name: Ion Blaster
reference: Please see page 162 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 176 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Ionization blasters are short-ranged weapons used to disable droids and other electronics.

name: Droid Disruptor
details: When used against organic creatures, the droid disruptor is much less effective. Any organic creature stuck by a droid disruptor does not receive normal damage, but instead simply experiences a brief shock to the system and suffers 2 strain.
reference: Please see page 104 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Organics hit with droid disruptor only receive brief shock and suffer 2 strain.

description: Verpine weaponsmiths enjoy creating specialized weapons, such as the Verpine droid disruptor.

name: Disruptor Pistol
reference: Please see page 163 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 176 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: While once dominant across the galaxy's battlefields, destructive disruptor technology has been banned for generations..

name: Disruptor Rifle
reference: Please see page 163 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 176 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Among the earliest known energy weapons dated by archaeologists, disruptor rifles predate blaster technology, and like disruptor pistols, they can completely disintegrate organic matter.

name: T-7 Ion Disruptor
details: Like other disruptor weapons, T-7 ion disruptors may never benefit from upgrades or attachments that improve their range or grant multiple shots. Whenever a living target is hit with a T-7 ion disruptor, any Critical Injury results in a "Crippled" effect, unless the [Critical Injury roll] would result in a more grievous injury.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Whenever a living target is hit with a T-7 ion disruptor, any Crititcal Injury results in a "Crippled" effect unless the roll on the Critical Injury table would result in a more grievous injury.
Whenever a vehicle or starship is hit with a T-7 ion distruptor, any Critical Hit results in a "Component Hit" effect, unless the roll on the Critical Hit table would result in a more serious effect.

description: A large ion disruptor rifle built for taking out aircraft and armored vehicles, the T-7 ion disruptor is a notorious weapon with a shameful past.

name: Slugthrower Pistol
reference: Please see page 164 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 177 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 169 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: The designers at Czerka Arms produce a line of ultra-modern slugthrowers, including the SH-9 pistol, with special forces units in mind.
details: Add one Black Setback die to Perception checks to find an SH-9 slughthrower pistol on a person's body. Add a Black Setback die to Perception and Vigilance checks made to locate a concealed shooter firing an SH-9 slugthrower pistol.

name: ASP-9 "Vrelt" Autopistol
reference: Please see page 96 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.
description: Common throughout the Corellian system, Talus Ironworks' ASP-9 is intended for pest control in rural areas.

name: Model C "Fiver" Pistol
reference: Please see page 45 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: KD-30 "Dissuader" Pistol
details: Target struck by a round from this weapon suffers 1 wound ignoring soak at the beginning of their turn for 2 rounds.
reference: Please see page 102 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Target struck by a round from the KD-30 suffers one wound, ignoring soak, at the beginning of his turn for the next two rounds.

description: This pistol fires a round filled with a vicious acid which is capable of burning all the way to the bone. While it is outlawed in most of civilized space, they are a common sight in Hutt Space.

name: Stealth-2VX Palm Shooter
details: Each dart can be loaded with one dose of Synthetic Neurotoxin, Synthetic Anesthetic, Synthetic Neuroparalytic, or any other poison the GM deems appropriate. Whenever the wielder successfully attack a target with the weapon (whether or not they deal damage), the target also suffers the effects of being exposed to the poison.
reference: Please see page 102 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to Perception checks to find a Stealth-2VX Palm Shooter on a wearer's body.

description: Considered by many to be the smallest ranged weapon in the galaxy, the Prax Arms Stealth-2VX palm shooter can, as then name suggests, easily fit in the palm of a user's hand.

name: SH-9 Slugthrower Pistol
details: Add one Black Setback die to Perception checks to find an SH-9 slughthrower pistol on a person's body. Add a Black Setback die to Perception and Vigilance checks made to locate a concealed shooter firing an SH-9 slugthrower pistol.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE] to Perception checks to find an SH-9 slugthrower pistol on a person's body.
Add [SE] to Perception or Vigilance checks made to locate a concealed shooter firing an SH-9 slugthrower pistol.

description: The designers at Czerka Arms produce a line of ultra-modern slugthrowers, including the SH-9 pistol, with special forces units in mind.

name: Vodran Hunting Rifle
reference: Please see page 102 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: These hunting rifles are typically hand crafted and found in the hands of Dianoga hunters. They are powerful enough for a hunt, but not the same power-level as basic blaster rifles.

name: Slugthrower Rifle
reference: Please see page 164 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 177 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 169 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Large and unwieldy kinetic weapons, from an older and uncivilised time. Most commonly seen used by Tusken raiders.

name: Mark V "Sand Panther" Hunting Rifle
reference: Please see page 97 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.
description: Engineers based Coronet Arms' Mark V "Sand Panther" on an ancient rifle once used to hunt Corellian sand panthers.

name: FYR Assault Carbine
details: The GM may spend two Threat or a Despair to cause a PC's Fyr assault carbine to run out of ammo.
reference: Please see page 45 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: [THREAT][THREAT] may cause weapon to run out of ammo.

description: Glunok is a relatively obscure Andoan arms manufacturer that offers a wide variety of modern combat slugthrowers.

name: Selonian Shard Shooter
reference: Please see page 97 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Model 77 Air Rifle
details: Upon a successful hit with a SmartTranq dart, the target must immediately make an Average (2 Difficulty) Resilience check. On failure, the target suffers 5 strain, plus 2 additional strain per threat result generated on the check. The Game Master may spend a despair result from the check to cause the target to repeat the check against the tranquilizer with the difficulty increased once at the beginning of the following round. Equipping a Model 77 with SmartTranq darts costs 500 credits; this modification has a rarity of 1. This does not change the weapon's profile—it simply adds the effects detailed above to the existing weapon. If it ever runs out of ammo, the user must purchase an additional reload at 500 credits (rarity 1) to use the SmartTranq.
reference: Please see page 39 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: Typically marketed to hobbyists and hunters, air rifles are lightweight, practical weapons used for target shooting and hunting.

name: Model 38 Sharpshooter's Rifle
details: If purchased used, a Czerka Model 38 loses the Accurate 2 quality until the rifle can be modified to fit the new shooter (requiring a Hard (3 Difficulty) Mechanics Check).
reference: Please see page 40 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: One of the best-selling firearms in Czerka's Legacy Arms slugthrower product line, each Model 38 is laser measured to accomodate a shooter's natural stance and includes a custom-fitted stock, trigger, and optic for optimal shooting comfort.

name: Model 38 Sharpshooter's Rifle (Detonator Round)
reference: Please see page 41 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: KS-23 Hammer
reference: Please see page 41 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: This slugthrower fires a canister of explosive pellets, which expands upon exiting the barrel - filling the area in front of the shooter with the dangerous ammunition. It is especially reliable and durable, gaining popularity in the Outer Rim where repair parts are often hard to come by.

name: DF-D1 Duo-Flechette Rifle
reference: Please see page 106 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: Salus Corporation is a Rodia-based arms and armor manufacturer known for its specialty weaponry. Its DF-D1 duo-flechette rifle is inspired by Golan Arms' Golan Arms FC1 Flechette Launcher.

name: Verpine Shatter Pistol
details: While a character wields a shatter gun, any combat checks they make that generates two threat results or a despair result damages the weapon by one step.
reference: Please see page 106 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: The shatter pistol is another configuration of shatter weapon and is designed to be light and easy to wield.

name: Verpine Shatter Rifle
details: While a character wields a shatter gun, any combat checks they make that generates two threat results or a despair result damages the weapon by one step.
reference: Please see page 106 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: Created by the insectoid Verpine, shatter guns use magnetic fields to propel small metal slugs at high speeds unattainable by typical slugthrowers.

name: Verpine Heavy Shatter Rifle
details: While a character wields a shatter gun, any combat checks they make that generates two threat results or a despair result damages the weapon by one step.
reference: Please see page 106 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: The heavy shatter rifle is another variant of the shatter weaponry created by the Verpine.

name: Model 57 "Homesteader" Hunting Rifle
details: Czerka produces a number of specialty ammunitions for use with its precision rifle lines, one of the most popular of which are the Detonator rounds. [...] When loaded in its Model 57 "Homesteader" rifle, these rounds have the following effect on the weapon's profile: Add the Blast (4) and Knockdown item qualities. Detonator rounds cost 450 credits per box and have a rarity of 7. If the weapon ever runs out of ammo, a new box of rounds must be purchased to load it.
reference: Please see page 41 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.
description: With a reputation for sturdy, reliable, no-nonsesne products, Czerka Arms has produced slugthrowers for the civilian and military market for millennia.

name: Berserker Rifle
reference: Please see page 46 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.
description: Similar in design to the Wookiee bowcaster, the berserker rifle magnetically accelerates electrically charge metal slugs at high speed toward targets.

name: Imperial Heavy Repeater
details: As a maneuver, a character wielding an Imperial heavy repeater may prime the weapon to expend all of its ammunition in a single, devastating burst. The next time the weapon is fired this encounter, it counts as having the Blast 7 and Concussive 1 qualities, but does not count as having the Auto-Fire quality. After being discharged this way, the weapon runs out of ammunition.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As a maneuver, user may prime the weapon to expend all of its ammunition in a single, devastating burst. The next time the weapon is fired this encounter, it counts as having the Blast 7 and Concussive 1 quality. After being discharged this way, the weapon runs out of ammunition.

description: A suppression fire and crowd control weapon used by the Imperial Army, the Imperial heavy repeater fires ionized bursts of metallic bolts at an incredibly rapid rate.

name: Bola/Net
details: A triumph result ensures target is entangled and may not make any maneuvers. Target must use an action and pass a Formidable (5 difficulty) Athletics check to escape.
reference: Please see page 164 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Electronet
reference: Please see page 44 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: Popular with corporate-funded explorers capturing creature for study, the electronet is a duracord net with interwoven conductive threads capable of delivering a stun charge to anything it touches.

name: Flame Projector
details: Thanks to their broad reach, flame projectors can easily catch multiple targets in a single blast. When triggering a flame projector's Burn quality, the user may choose to apply it to any single target hit by the attack; this quality may be triggered multiple times, affecting a different target each time. The downside to this weapon's volatility and indiscriminate area of effect is that allies can easily be caught in its flames. Game Masters may spend two threat results or a despair result to apply a flame projector's Burn quality to an ally hit by the original attack.
reference: Please see page 165 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 178 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Packing the devastation of a flame projector into the compact frame of a pistol, Merr-Sonn's "Firecaller" light flame projector is banned throughout most of civilized space.

name: Missile Tube
details: Additional ammo for a missile tube costs 500 credits per rack of six. Other Missles may be substituted for the standard type, replacing the damage, critical rating, range, and special qualities with that of the alternate missile. Alternate missiles may be purchased for their listed price.
reference: Please see page 165 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 178 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 170 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Missile tubes are shoulder-fired, portable launchers capable of firing a variety of small but deadly warheads.

name: L70 Acid Projector
details: Acid projectors operate similarly to flame projectors, spraying targets in a narrow cone. When triggering the weapon's Burn quality, the user may choose to apply it to any one target hit by the attack; this quality may be triggered multiple times, affecting a different target each time. The GM can spend two Threat results or a Despair result to apply the weapon's Burn quality to an ally hit by the original attack. Since the burn is chemical in nature, the Burn damage cannot be stopped by rolling around on the ground or jumping into water.
reference: Please see page 102 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Burn quality may be activated multiple times, affecting a different target hit by the attack each time.
GM may spend [THREAT][THREAT] or [DESPAIR] to apply Burn quality to an ally hit by original attack.

description: Tenloss Syndicates' rifle-sized L70 acid projector, which is banned in virtually all systems, fires a stream of xenoboric acid capable of penetrating virtually any material.

name: AO14 "Aranea" Net Gun
reference: Please see page 42 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook, or page 41 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook, for details.
description: The AO14 "Aranea" is one of Palandrix Personal Protection Gear's more popular non-lethal weapon systems.

name: Electronet Launcher
reference: Please see page 60 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.
description: An ideal weapon for subduing most sentient beings, the electronet launcher uses the same concept as a conventional net launcher, but without the tangled mess of a physical net.

name: Stokhli Spray Stick
reference: Please see page 41 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: R-88 Supressor Riot Rifle
details: While the stun fluid is effective against sudden riots, other disturbances, and even rodent infestations, it is easily countered by breath masks and heavy clothing. This makes it less effective against determined, well-organized targets expecting such weapons. At the GM's discretion, characters wearing breathing gear or sealed armor may ignore the R-88's damage and effects.
reference: Please see page 40 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

name: Tangle Gun
reference: Please see page 41 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: Merr-Sonn Munitions' Tangle Gun 7 is an attempt to fit all of the power of a net launcher into a compact pistol frame.

name: Frag Grenade
details: Frag grenades can be set to detonate on impact or set with a timer to detonate up to three rounds after being activated at the beginning of the attacker's action. Some also have a dead man's pressure switch that, once pressed, detonates immediately upon release.
reference: Please see page 165 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 178 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 170 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Stun Grenade
details: They can be set to detonate on impact or in 3 rounds.
reference: Please see page 165 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 179 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 170 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Speizoc's spore stun grenade deploys a cloud of spores harvested from a carnivorous plant that acts as a powerful soporific for most species.

name: Thermal Detonator
details: Any despair result on a check involving a thermal detonator means that the device explodes prematurely. If this should occur, the wielder takes full damage from the weapon unless they have a maneuver with which they can attempt to avoid the blast. If this is the case, the wielder takes only the Blast damage from the explosion. Thermal detonators can be set to detonate on impact or after a delay of up to three rounds using the built-in timer. When used in delay mode, the thermal detonator explodes at the beginning of the attacker's turn when it reaches its set time. In addition, most thermal detonators are equipped with a dead man's switch similar to that on frag grenades. Finally, thermal detonators are so potent that their Blast quality affects everyone and everything within short range of its intended target.
reference: Please see page 165 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 180 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 170 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: This insidious device is only half the size of a typical Frag Grenade.

name: Mini Thermal Detonator
details: Any despair result on a check involving a thermal detonator means that the device explodes prematurely. If this should occur, the wielder takes full damage from the weapon unless they have a maneuver with which they can attempt to avoid the blast. If this is the case, the wielder takes only the Blast damage from the explosion. Thermal detonators can be set to detonate on impact or after a delay of up to three rounds using the built-in timer. When used in delay mode, the thermal detonator explodes at the beginning of the attacker's turn when it reaches its set time. In addition, most thermal detonators are equipped with a dead man's switch similar to that on frag grenades. Finally, thermal detonators are so potent that their Blast quality affects everyone and everything within short range of its intended target.
reference: Please see page 36 of the Under a Black Sun adventure for details.
description: This insidious device is only half the size of a typical Frag Grenade.

name: Armor Piercing Grenade
details: Armor-piercing grenades can be set to detonate on impact, can be set with a timer to detonate up to three rounds after being activated, or can use a pressure detonator.
reference: Please see page 179 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.
description: Merr-Sonn's AP-M1 armor piercing grenade is designed to give the common foot soldier light anti-armor capabilities on the field.

name: N-4 Noise Grenade
reference: Please see page 44 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.
description: Developed for crowd dispersal and riot control, Merr-Sonn's N-4 noise grenade emits a sharp blast of broad-spectrum sound, causing intense pain to those near the epicenter.

name: Wipe-3 Data-Purge Grenade
details: Any computer or similar device hit by a data-purge grenade loses all programming, memory, and any other kind of electronically stored data but remains otherwise undamaged. A droid hit by a data-purge grenade must succeed on a Hard (3 Difficulty) Resilience Check or suffer 1 strain, plus 1 additional strain per Failure result. At the GM's discretion, three Threat results or a Despair result on the check can cause the droid to lose portions of its memory.
reference: Please see page 45 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Computers hit by this grenade lose all programming and data.

A droid hit by this grenade must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] or suffer 1 strain plus 1 strain per [FAILURE]. [DESPAIR] or [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT] can cause memory loss, at GM discretion.

description: SoroSuub's Wipe-3 data-purge grenade erases electronically stored data from all devices within its blast radius with a brief, but intense, electromagnetic pulse.

name: HIC "Mercy" Grenade
details: A character hit by a Mercy grenade must make a Hard (3 Difficulty) Resilience Check to avoid having an incomplete or inaccurate memory of events that transpire during that encounter. Additionally, they become disoriented for one round per Threat result on the check.
reference: Please see page 45 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A character hit by this grenade must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] or become disoriented for 1 round per [THREAT]. Additionally, he has an inaccurate or incomplete memory of the encounter.

description: The "Mercy" grenade is a unique gas-based stun grenade which is typically used by large corporations and by covert agencies via shell corporations.

name: Spore/B Stun Grenade
details: When hit by the weapon (regardless of damage) for the first time, target must roll a single challenge die. Upon a despair result, suffer 6 strain and begin to suffocate. A Hard (3 difficulty) Medicine check is required to stop the subject from suffocating. Weapon is ineffective against targets with a breathing mask or sealed suit.
reference: Please see page 107 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: The first time a character hit by this grenade (even if he suffers no damage) must roll a single [CH]. As long as the character doesn't roll a [DE], he is affected normally.  If he rolls a [DE], he immediately suffers 6 strain and begins to suffocate.  A [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Medicine check[b] is required to stop the subject from suffocating.

description: Produced by Czerka Arms, the Spore/B stun grenade employs stun spores to disable opponents.

name: Anti-Vehicle Mine
reference: Please see page 179 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.
description: Anti-vehicle mines are large, heavy explosive devices capable of destroying walkers, airspeeders, and other terrestrial vehicles.

name: Anti-Personnel Mine
reference: Please see page 179 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.
description: Anti-personnel mines are small, concealed explosive devices capable of killing squads of infantry.

name: Knockout Mine
details: Characters hit by the mine must pass a Hard (3 difficulty) Resilience check. Upon failure they become immobilized until the end of the encounter.
reference: Please see page 45 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.
description: Sought after as a non-lethal anti-personnel solution, these mines allow for an early warning system against unwanted intruders.

name: Glop Grenade
details:
A glop grenade's Ensnare quality triggers automatically on any targets the weapon hits, with no need to spend Advantage results. 

While glop grenades are ostensibly nonlethal, accidents do happen, and they have been known to cause death due to suffocation or, in extremely rare cases, allergic reaction. Targets hit with a glop grenade must make an Easy (1 Difficulty) Coordination Check to keep the foam from filling their breathing passages. Failure indicates that the foam has cut off the target's air, and they immediately suffer the effects of suffocation. 

Glop grenades that are recovered after use can be refilled with special pressurized hypoinjectors that transfer the foam from a sealed container into the grenade's reservoir without exposing it to the atmosphere. This requires an Easy (1 Difficulty) Ranged - Light Check to complete. Failure on the check indicates that the foam has been ruined, and any net Threat result means that some mishap occurs and the user is engulfed in quickly hardening goo. This requires the user to make an Easy (1 Difficulty) Coordination Check to avoid getting the goo in their nose or mouth per the rules above. Purchase of a glop grenade includes the hypoinjector and five refill canisters. Additional refill canisters can be purchased for 100 credits apiece and have a Rarity of 6.
reference: Please see page 42 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: Merr-Sonn's G-20 glop grenade is a reusable non-lethal anti-personnel grenade that law enforcement uses to capture fleeing suspects and occasionally for riot suppression.

name: D-24 Inferno Grenade
reference: Please see page 46 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: G2 Concussion Grenade
details: If a concussion grenade's Disorient quality is activated it affects all characters within short range of the target.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Disorient affects all characters in Short range, even if not damaged.

name: Lightning 22 Ion Grenade
reference: Please see page 46 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

reference: Please see page 46 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: Mk.4 Heavy Frag Grenade
reference: Please see page 46 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: Poison Gas Grenade
details:
Upon impact, the grenade uses several emitters to spray aerosolized Synthetic Neurotoxin, Synthetic Anesthetic, Synthetic Neuroparalytic, or any other poison at the GM's discretion. 

Unless a poison gas grenade is used outdoors in a windy environment, the poison gas lingers for two rounds, affecting anyone caught in the cloud. If the grenade is detonated in a closed, poorly ventilated space, such as a small room or narrow starship corridor, the gas lingers for five rounds instead. Poison gas grenades do not harm droids and other creatures that do not breathe air. Characters equipped with vacuum-sealed suits, breath masks, respirators, or rebreathers are also unaffected by poison gas, at the GM's discretion.
reference: Please see page 102 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May be loaded with 1 dose of neurotoxin, anesthetic, or neuroparalytic, or other suitable toxins.
Unless outdoors in a windy environment, gas lingers for two rounds, affecting anyone in the cloud. In a poorly ventilated space, gas lingers for five rounds.
Droids, or characters equipped with sealed suits, breath masks, respirators, or rebreathers, are unaffected.

description: Poison gas grenades store a concentrated gas, most often Dioxis Gas, trion, or Fex-M3.

name: Shaped Thermal Grenade
reference: Please see page 47 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.
description: This sequencer charge is common among marines and special forces units in need of an explosive to breach reinforced hatches.

name: CSPL-12 Projectile Launcher (Frag Grenade)
details: The GM may spend a despair result from a combat check with this weapon to cause it to jam, detonating and inflicting a hit from the loaded grenade on the wielder and every other character at engaged range. Further, the weapon becomes damaged two steps; from undamaged to Moderate, from Minor to Major, or Moderate to Major. The GM may spend additional despair results to trigger one of the loaded grenade's qualities.
reference: Please see page 47 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: The GM may spend [DE] from a combat check with this weapon to cause it to jam, detonating the contents, inflicting a hit from the loaded grenade on the wielder and each character at engaged range, and damaging the weapon two steps. The GM may spend additional [DE] to trigger one of the loaded grenade's qualities.

name: LJ-50 Concussion Rifle
reference: Please see page 47 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.
description: The LJ-50 concussion rifle is a heavy weapon dating from before the Clone Wars.

name: Mk.10 Concussion Missile
details: When a concussion missile's Disorient quality is activated, it affects all characters within short range of the target. If the Concussive quality is activated, it affects all characters engaged with the target.
reference: Please see page 42 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Disorient affects all characters in Short range, even if not damaged.  Concussive affects all Engaged characters, even if not damaged.

base_mods.misc_desc: Damage uses Planetary scale, Blast uses Personal scale. [DESPAIR] means it detonates immediately. +50 to critical if Engaged when detonates.

Additional Damage +6.

description: Often used for demolitions work, proton grenades are powerful explosives based on proton torpedo warhead technology.

name: FC1 Flechette Launcher (Anti-Vehicle)
