reference: Please see page 45 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: Z50 Grenade Launcher
details: The listed price does not include ammunition. Grenades for a grenade launcher cost the same as the equivalent hand grenades, though many merchants offer a 50% discount on cases of six. The weapon can fire any grenade, although the grenade launcher projectiles are different than hand grenades (grenade launcher projectiles also cannot be thrown; they must be fired from the grenade launcher). The character should specify what type of grenades [they] want when purchasing them. The listed profile represents the Z50 loaded with standard fragmentation grenade. When this launcher uses other grenades, they replace its damage, critical rating, and item qualities with their own.
reference: Please see page 42 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: Malaxan Firepower Incorporated's Z50 is the industry standard when it comes to grenade launchers, and many planetary defense forces and mercenaries field the weapon..

name: Mini-Torpedo Launcher
details: Upgrade difficulty of combat checks outside water twice. Weapon profile is using Anti-Personnel mini torpedo ammunition. Other mini-torpedoes are available, replacing the profile with that of the torpedo being used.
reference: Please see page 107 of Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: All combat checks to operate outside of water have their difficulty upgraded twice.

description: The Mon Cal Defenses mini-torpedo launcher is a portable weapon designed exclusively for sub-aquatic combat situations.

name: Mini-Torpedo, Anti-Personnel
reference: Please see page 107 of Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.      [P][I]For use with the Mon Cal Defenses Mini-Torpedo Launcher[i]
description: Anti-personnel mini-torpedoes function similarly to fragmentation grenades.

name: Mini-Torpedo, Armor Piercing
reference: Please see page 107 of Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.      [P][I]For use with the Mon Cal Defenses Mini-Torpedo Launcher[i]
description: Armor piercing mini-torpedoes are designed to damage single targets, utilizing a shaped explosive charge.

name: Mini-Torpedo, Ink
details: Ink cloud forms within short range and lasts 4 rounds (or longer in still water).
reference: Please see page 107 of Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.      [P][I]For use with the Mon Cal Defenses Mini-Torpedo Launcher[i]

base_mods.misc_desc: Ink obscures vision and blocks line of sight for up to 4 rounds.

description: These mini-torpedoes contain a reservoir filled with an obscuring black liquid that readily disperses into a large cloud upon detonation.

name: Mini-Torpedo, Ion
reference: Please see page 107 of Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.      [P][I]For use with the Mon Cal Defenses Mini-Torpedo Launcher[i]
description: For use primarily against droids and vehicles, ion mini-torpedoes were a popular choice for the Mon Calamari during the Battle of Mon Cala.

name: Mini-Torpedo, Net
reference: Please see page 107 of Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.      [P][I]For use with the Mon Cal Defenses Mini-Torpedo Launcher[i]
description: The net mini-torpedo is designed to ensnare targets rather than damage them.

name: Mini-Torpedo, Stun
reference: Please see page 107 of Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.      [P][I]For use with the Mon Cal Defenses Mini-Torpedo Launcher[i]
description: Combining a concussive blast with a series of blinding flashes, stun mini-torpedoes are especially effective underwater.

name: Aurateran Boomerang
details: If retrieved, a thrown boomerang can be used again. A character may spend an Advantage result on a missed attack (including an attack made with the Guided quality) to have the boomerang return to the user's hand.
reference: Please see page 102 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: If retrieved, boomerang can be used again.
May spend [AD] on missed attack to have boomerange return to thrower's hand.

description: Although Auraterans have access to modern energy weapons, the simply but reliable boomerang is still a popular weapon for local hunters and trappers.

name: Gungan Atlatl
details: Atlatls throw Gungan Plasma Ball, giving them greater range. An atlatl must have a supply of plasma balls for ammunition.
reference: Please see page 102 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: An atlatl must have a supply of plasma balls for ammunition.

description: A Gungan warrior could throw one of [their] signature plasma balls like a grenade (and often do), but a Gungan atlatl gives the weapon a greater range and aids in accuracy.

name: Gungan Plasma Ball
reference: Please see page 102 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: Plasma balls are the predominant ammunition for Gungan weaponry.

name: Long Bow
details: A longbow requires a supply of arrows to fire; if the GM needs to set a price, they can charge 1 credit per arrow.
reference: Please see page 102 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.

name: Brass Knuckles
details: Add a Black Setback die to a character's Perception check when attempting to find a set of brass knuckles on a person's body.
reference: Please see page 166 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 180 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 171 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Known colloquially as "knuckle-dusters" in many locations, brass knuckles are a set of thick metal rings welded to a horizontal bar held in the fist.

name: Shock Gloves
reference: Please see page 166 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 180 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 171 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Produced by Corellian Personal Defense and marketed toward bodyguards, security forces, and law enforcement, Backhand series shock gloves pack the power of a stun baton into a glove.
details: Its Slow-Firing 1 rule means this weapon can be used only once every other round. While a character may still make Brawl checks when this weapon is recharging, they do so without any benefit from the weapon—they simply make an unarmed melee attack.

name: Refined Cortosis Gauntlets
details: While in combat with a lightsaber wielder, may spend 3 disadvantage results from an opponent's combat roll targeting them to short out the lightsaber. Alternatively, may spend 3 advantage results from own combat check to short out the opponent's lightsaber.
reference: Please see page 171 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When attacked by a lightsaber, [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] may be spent to cause the lightsaber to short out and deactivate after the combat check is resolved.
When attacking an enemy armed with a lightsaber, [AD][AD][AD] or [TR] may be spent to cause the lightsaber to short out and deactivate after the combat check is resolved.

name: Blast Knuckles
details: When a character uses blast knuckles, every successful hit inflicts 1 strain on the wielder (in addition to any strain suffered due to check results). Blast knuckles cannot deal damage to a target's strain threshold.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Every successful hit inflicts 1 strain on wielder.

description: This unusual weapon consists of a heavy, armored glove with a small, integrated blaster emitter.

name: S-1 Vamblade (Single)
details: Vamblades are designed to be worn as a pair and open up a whole range of combat options when wielded by a properly trained fighter. When used as a pair, these wristblades gain the Sunder and Accurate 1 item qualities. Vamblades cannot deal damage to a target's strain threshold.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: S-1 Vamblade (Paired)
description: Falling somewhere between brass knuckles and a sword, vamblades are dagger-length blades extending from durasteel vambraces, which mount the blade and provide a degree of protection to the wielder's forearms.
details: Vamblades are designed to be worn as a pair and open up a whole range of combat options when wielded by a properly trained fighter. When used as a pair, these wristblades gain the Sunder and Accurate 1 item qualities. Vamblades cannot deal damage to a target's strain threshold.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: Vibroknucklers
details: Add a Black Setback die to any attempts to locate vibroknucklers concealed on an individual's body. Vibroknucklers cannot deal damage to a target's strain threshold.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK] to attempts to locate a concealed vibroknuckler.

description: As intimidating as they are lethal, vibroknucklers are worn like brass knuckles..

name: Backhand Shock Gloves
details: Its Slow-Firing 1 rule means this weapon can be used only once every other round. While a character may still make Brawl (Br)|Brawl checks when this weapon is recharging, they do so without any benefit from the weapon—they simply make an unarmed melee attack.
reference: Please see page 42 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: Produced by Corellian Personal Defense and marketed toward bodyguards, security forces, and law enforcement, Backhand series shock gloves pack the power of a stun baton into a glove.

name: Needle Gloves
details: Needle gloves may be loaded with one dose of Synthetic Neurotoxin, Synthetic Anesthetic, Synthetic Neuroparalytic, or any other poison the GM deems appropriate. Whenever the wielder successfully attacks a target with the weapon (even if they deal no damage), the target also suffers the effects of being exposed to the poison. Add three Black Setback dice to a character's Perception checks to determine that a set of needle gloves contains a lethal weapon.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK][SETBACK][SETBACK] to determine that needle gloves are lethal.

description: To all appearances, needle gloves look like typical hand coverings; however, with a specific hand gesture, the wearer can extend an ultrathin needle that is otherwise nearly undetectable.

name: Shield Gauntlet
details: A shield gauntlet counts as a Lightsaber weapon for the purposes of the Reflect talent.
reference: Please see page 44 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: Shield gauntlets are specialized defensive items popularized by the Kilian Rangers of Kilia IV.

name: Combat Knife
reference: Please see page 166 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 181 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 172 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: This physical blade is a common sight in the fringe worlds. Carried by less elite troops, it serves its purpose as a close-quarters combat weapon.

name: Explorer's Knife
details: An explorer's knife grants a Blue Boost die to all Survival checks.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Grants [BO] to all Survival checks.

description: Nearly as ubiquitous as combat knives, explorer's knives are indispensable tools for professional foresters.

name: MSW-12 NanoDagger
details: The GM may spend three Threat results or a Despair result from any combat check made with this weapon to have it become damaged one step (from undamaged to minor, minor to moderate, moderate to major, etc).
reference: Please see page 44 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May spend [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] from combat checks with this weapon to have it become damaged one step.

description: Another MSW-series mono-molecular blade offering by Xana Exotic Arms, the MSW-12 NanoDagger is a larger, deadlier version of the MSW-9 Molecular Stiletto.

name: Corellian Cutlass
reference: Please see page 97 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.
description: This ornamental blade is traditionally granted to Corellian naval officers when promoted to lieutenant. It is an effective weapon, despite being for show.

name: Longeing Whip
details: This weapon can be used to make melee attack against targets at up to short range (the difficulty remains Average (2 Difficulty)).
reference: Please see page 41 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.
description: Used for guiding riderless beasts and driving teams of creatures, a longeing whip is an essential piece of a beast rider's kit.

name: Shock Whip
reference: Please see page 60 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.
description: The shock whip has been a mainstay of the Zygerrian Slave Empire for thousands of years.

name: Sorosuub "Persuader" Shock Prod
reference: Please see page 41 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

name: Ceremonial Blade
details: A character adds a Blue Boost die to checks to convince others to allow them to retain their ceremonial blade.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BOOST] when attempting to convince others to allow him to retain his ceremonial blade.

description: The ritualistic presentation of weapons has strong roots in many cultures, especially those with a militaristic tradition.

name: Staff of Office
details: Requires 2 hands to wield. Add 2 boost dice when attempting to convince a characters to allow him to retain his staff of office.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [BOOST][BOOST] when attempting to convince others to allow him to retain his staff of office.

description: Many cultures distribute symbols of their office, and often these appear as staves or walking sticks. They are often permitted into secure locations, despite their ability to be used as a weapon, due to their cultural importance.

name: Ancient Sword
reference: Please see page 172 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
description: This old physical weapon is from a time before lightsabers, used by the Jedi and Sith alike in their ancient battles.

name: Cortosis Shield
reference: Please see page 172 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
description: Those who deal with the remnants of the Jedi Order, such as the Inquisitors and the secret police units of the Galactic Empire, often have need of specialized equipment to reduce the effectiveness of suspected Jedi and their lightsabers.

name: Cortosis Sword
reference: Please see page 173 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
description: The making and use of cortosis swords is, perhaps, as old as the making and use of lightsabers.

name: Electrostaff
reference: Please see page 173 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
description: This double sided weapon is weaved with cortosis, allowing it to be used as an effective weapon against lightsaber wielding foes.

name: Refined Cortosis Staff
details: When a character armed with a lightsaber makes a combat check targeting an opponent armed with a refined cortosis staff, three threat results or a despair result can be spent to cause the lightsaber to short out and deactivate after the combat check has been resolved. The lightsaber may be reactivated as an incidental, but it may not be reactivated until after the last Initiative slot during the next round. Cortosis staves require two hands to use.
reference: Please see page 173 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

name: Gaffi Stick
details: Gaffi sticks require two hands to use.
reference: Please see page 166 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: The Tusken Raiders of Tatooine carry brutal staves made from desert tracti hardwood, krayt dragon horn or bone, or scavenged metal.

name: Drall Flashstick
reference: Please see page 98 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

name: Force Pike
details:
When set to its Stun Setting, a force pike loses the benefit of the Pierce 2 quality.

Force pikes require two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 166 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 181 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 174 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Designed by a number of manufacturers as an easy-to-use crowd-control tool for military and law enforcement agencies, the force pike combines the deadliness of a vibro weapon and the utility of a stun weapon in one package.

name: Diiro
details: This weapon may be loaded with up to 3 doses of poison. Whenever an successful attack is made, the target suffers the effect of the poison. When the weapon is damaged, increase the damage by 1 step.
reference: Please see page 26 of the Chronicles of the Gatekeeper Adventure Module for details.[P]      [I]Note: The diiro may only be found on Arbooine.[i]
description: This is a traditional weapon found on Arbooine, made of a single hollowed out shaft of wood - tipped with a sharp alloy blade.

name: Coral Pike
reference: Please see page 108 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: The coral pike is an ancient weapon of the Mon Calamari people.

name: Energy Lance
details: A mounted wielder of an energy lance may use their steed's Brawn rating instead of their own Brawn rating to determine the damage of this weapon. If the wielder is not mounted, the weapon has the Cumbersome 3 quality.
reference: Please see page 108 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook, or page 44 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook, for details.
description: Wielded by the Mon Calamari Knights during the Clone Wars, energy lances are designed to be used from atop keelkana mounts.

name: CS-12 Stun Master
details: Add a Black Setback die to a character's Perception checks to find a Stun Master on a person's body.
reference: Please see page 108 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: Produced by SoroSuub and popular with many Sullustans, the CS-12 Stun Master is one of the more ubiquitous non-lethal self-defense weapons in the galaxy.

name: Energy Buckler
details: When the wielder is using an energy buckler, the GM can spend any Despair result the wielder generates on a Combat check to have the energy buckler run out of power; it ceases to function until the end of the encounter or until recharged.
reference: Please see page 45 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: The GM may spend [DE] to have the energy buckler run out of power and stop functioning until the end of the encounter.

description: An energy buckler consists of a metallic disk worn on the wielder's wrist.

name: Parrying Vibroblade
reference: Please see page 45 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: The parrying vibroblade is a high-tech version of the Parrying Dagger.

name: Parrying Dagger
reference: Please see page 45 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: Typically used in the off hand, the traditional parrying dagger consists of a slim, double-edged blade with a wide guard or a basket hilt for hand protection.

name: Rodian Cryogen Whip
details: This weapon can be used to make melee attacks against targets up to short range (the difficulty remains Average (2 Difficulty))
reference: Please see page 45 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: Developed by Rodian hunters as an offensive weapon, the cryogen whip appears to be little more than a simple whips with an outer coating of metal rungs.

name: Sith Shield
details: Whenever a Force-sensitive wielder of a Sith shield suffers a hit in combat, [they] may commit a White Force die to channel [their] fury into the shield as an out of turn incidental. Over multiple attacks, [they] may commit multiple White Force dice this way, up to a total number of White Force dice no greater than [their] Force rating.
reference: Please see page 45 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When hit, may commit [FO] as OOT Incidental.  As action, may uncommit all [FO] and make a Force power check with that many [FO], taking 1 Conflict per [FO]. May spend [FP] to inflict 1 wound and 1 strain, ignoring soak, on each character within short range.

description: The shields used by Sith warriors in ages past can still be found, though they are rare in the extreme.

name: Snap Baton
reference: Please see page 45 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: Snap batons are light, collapsible truncheons often employed by law enforcers and bounty hunters.

name: Bardottan Electrolance
details: The Bardottan electrolance is a one-handed weapon, however it cannot be wielded with other weapons. It may, at the GM's discretion, be wielded while using a shield.
reference: Please see page 103 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: Bardottans traditionally wield a one-handed lance as a ceremonial weapon.

name: Gungan Electropole
details: An electropole may be thrown as a ranged weapon. If used in this manner, change the skill to Ranged - Light and the range of the weapon to short. The weapon also gains the Limited Ammo 1 quality (but can be retrieved and used again).
reference: Please see page 103 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: Gungan herders traditionally use electropoles to guide and guard their shaaks.

name: Gungan Personal Energy Shield
details: The value of the Gungan personal energy shield's Defensive quality is reduced to 0 while the wielder is suffering from the staggered or disoriented condition.
reference: Please see page 103 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: Gungan engineering incorporates a particularly advanced understanding of shielding technologies.

name: Training Stick
details: This weapon appears to be a harmless cane. Add three Black Setback dice to a character's Perception or Vigilance checks to discern this weapon's true nature.
reference: Please see page 104 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: The Jedi have used lightsabers for so long that most forget there may have been a time when they had no access to energy weapons.

name: Voss Warspear
details:
The Voss warspear is a one-handed weapon, however it cannot be wielded with other weapons. It may, at the GM's discretion, be wielded while using a shield.

A spear may be thrown as a ranged weapon. If used in this manner, change the skill to Ranged - Light and the range of the weapon to short. The weapon also gains the Limited Ammo 1 quality (but if retrieved, it can be used again).
reference: Please see page 104 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: A spear is essentially a blade at the end of a long pole, typically about two meters in length.

name: Weik Greatsword
details: The greatsword requires two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 104 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: Regardless of technological advances, a simple metal sword remains an effective and reliable weapon.

name: Thermal Cutter
details: A thermal cutter's charge lasts for roughly five minutes of continuous use, and can remove one cubic meter of snow per minute, or dig through 10 centimeters of ice per minute. If plugged into a fusion lantern, it can run indefinitely, otherwise it requires a new battery. Nefarious individuals can also use a thermal cutter as a weapon with the following profile (Melee ; Damage 4; Critical 4; Range [Engaged]; Burn 1, Inaccurate 2).
reference: Please see page 105 of the Nexus of Power Sourcebook for details.
description: Designed for cold-weather expeditions, the Copora-Tech Thermal Cutter is basically a scaled-down mining beamdrill.

name: SVT-300 Stun Cloak
details: When wearer is hit by a melee or brawl attack, attacker suffers 7 strain damage, consuming one of the cloak's payload. Reloading the power source takes 3 minutes.
reference: Please see page 108 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: At first glance, the Koromondain SVT-300 stun cloak appears to be nothing more than a typical thermal cloak with a handsome metallic sheen.

name: Lightsaber
reference: Please see page 167 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 182 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: The basic lightsaber is a simple but exceedingly elegant weapon.

name: Double-Bladed Lightsaber
details:
Although this weapon contains two lightsaber crystals (one for each blade), for the purposes of gameplay it is treated as having a single crystal. This lightsaber is a Double-Bladed Lightsaber Hilt containing an unmodded Ilum Crystal. This crystal occupies two of the weapon's hard points.

When purchasing attachments for this weapon (including crystals), each attachment costs double the listed price. This represents the fact that the double-bladed lightsaber generally requires two of each attachment (one for each end). However, when installing and modding these attachments, follow all normal rules.
reference: Please see page 176 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
description: Also called lightstaves or Sith lightsabers, double-bladed lightsabers date from the mythical Sith Lord Exar Kun of the Qel-Droma Epics.

name: Lightsaber Pike
details: This lightsaber is a Lightsaber Pike Hilt containing an unmodded Ilum Crystal. This crystal occupies two of the weapon's hard points.
reference: Please see page 176 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
description: Similar in construction to a force pike or electrostaff, a lightsaber pike consists of a long, sturdy haft typically made of composites or strong alloys.

name: Shoto
details:
This lightsaber is a Guard Shoto Hilt containing an unmodded Ilum Crystal. This crystal occupies two of the weapon's hard points.

When installing a lightsaber crystal into a guard shoto reduce the damage of that lightsaber crystal by one.
reference: Please see page 177 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
description: Similar to the Shoto lightsaber, the guard shoto, or lightsaber tonfa, is a lightsaber with its grip set perpendicular to the blade, allowing the wielder to rapidly switch between attack and defense, deflecting bolts and blows one moment and lashing out with circular attacks of blinding speed the next.

name: Training Lightsaber
details:
This lightsaber is a Basic Lightsaber Hilt containing an unmodded Training Lightsaber Emitter. The crystal occupies two of the weapon's hard points.

Lightsabers cannot be Sundered.
reference: Please see page 178 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
description: Ostensibly non-lethal variants of the standard lightsaber, training lightsabers are low-powered lightsabers used to train Jedi youngling ins lightsaber combat.

name: Guard Shoto
details:
This lightsaber is a Guard Shoto Hilt containing an unmodded Ilum Crystal. This crystal occupies two of the weapon's hard points.

When installing a lightsaber crystal into a guard shoto reduce the damage of that lightsaber crystal by one.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: Similar to the Shoto lightsaber, the guard shoto, or lightsaber tonfa, is a lightsaber with its grip set perpendicular to the blade, allowing the wielder to rapidly switch between attack and defense, deflecting bolts and blows one moment and lashing out with circular attacks of blinding speed the next.

name: Temple Guard Lightsaber Pike
details:
For the purposes of gameplay, this weapon is treated as having a single crystal. This lightsaber is a Double-Bladed Lightsaber Hilt containing an unmodded Ilum Crystal. This crystal occupies two of the weapon's hard points.

When purchasing attachments for this weapon (including crystals), each attachment costs double the listed price. This represents the fact that the double-bladed lightsaber generally requires two of each attachment (one for each end). However, when installing and modding these attachments, follow all normal rules.

A Temple Guard lightsaber pike requires two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Keeping the Peace sourcebook for details.
description: The Jedi Temple Guard were the elite defenders of the Jedi Temple in the days of old, tasked with maintaining order and protecting those who resided within.

name: Basic Lightsaber Hilt
reference: Please see page 177 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
details: [A lightsaber hilt] requires a Kyber Crystals to become a true weapon (otherwise they deal no damage, have no critical rating, and do not have many of their item qualities).

name: Truncheon
reference: Please see page 167 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 182 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 174 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Essentially, a mace, typically used by law enforcement and individuals who do not wish to mortally wound anyone.

name: Stun Club
reference: Please see page 13 of The Jewel of Yavin Adventure Module for details.

name: G9-G Pulse Drill
reference: Please see page 43 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

name: G9-GX Pulse Drill
reference: Please see page 139 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: Designed as a handheld complement to the tried-and-true G2-GE beamdrill, the G9-GX uses a variable-strength, continuous-beam plasma projector to perform all manner of jobs, from cutting to welding and brazing to incinerating waster material and industrial byproducts.

name: J-7b Beamdrill
reference: Please see page 98 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.
description: The standard drill used by the Corellian Mining Corporation, this tool has been used since before the Clone Wars. Used as a makeshift weapon, the drill can be extremely lethal.

name: Entrenching Tool (Improvised)
details: Besides allowing the user to dig holes and trenches, an entrenching tool counts as a small improvised weapon that deals +2 damage, has a critical rating of 4, and does not break due to threat or despair results.
reference: Please see page 59 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Does not break due to [DESPAIR] or [THREAT].

name: Selonian Glaive
reference: Please see page 98 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.
description: Individually crafted by Selonian females as a rite of passage, these weapons are often of sublime craftsmanship. The blades are made out of a particularly stronger form of obsidian, providing a deadly cutting edge.

name: Trailbreaker Poleaxe
details: The Trailbreaker poleaxe requires two hands to use.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.
description: LaserHone's Trailbreak is a versatile piece of equipment designed for exploration, search and rescue, and wilderness survival.

name: Vibro-ax
details: A vibro-ax requires two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 167 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 182 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 175 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: This massive pole-axe has a head which has an ultrasonic vibration generator which enhances its damaging power.

name: Vibroknife
reference: Please see page 167 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 182 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 174 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Compared to traditional knives, a vibroblade can be made smaller while remaining deadly.
details: Add two Black Setback dice to a character's Perception checks to find a stealth vibroknife on a person's body.

name: Stealth Vibroknife
details: Add two Black Setback dice to a character's Perception checks to find a stealth vibroknife on a person's body.
reference: Please see page 46 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK][SETBACK] to Perception checks to find a stealth vibroknife on a person's body.

description: Compared to traditional knives, a vibroblade can be made smaller while remaining deadly.

name: Vibrosword
reference: Please see page 167 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 182 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 175 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Extraordinarily difficult to wield and as dangerous to an untrained user as to their enemy, the double-bladed vibrosword is an uncommon variant of the more familiar vibrosword.
details: A double-bladed vibrosword requires two hands to wield.

name: Sword Cane
details: Add 1 setback die to Perception checks to determine a sword cane is a lethal weapon.
reference: Please see page 47 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to determine that a sword cane is actually a lethal weapon.

description: This traditional accessory of the aristocracy, concealing weapons within canes is popular among those who worry about their safety but wish to keep up an appearance of civility.

name: Huntsman Vibrospear
details: The Huntsman vibrospear requires two hands to use.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: The Corporate Sector–based LaserHone effectively created the vibrospear market with its Huntsman model.

name: Mk. VIII Vibrosaw
details: The weapon requires two hands to wield. A despair result gets the user hit with the attack instead of the target (even if it would have missed).
reference: Please see page 43 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
description: This weapon is often used by wood-working companies, consisting of a large blade with an extremely loud motor and is especially bulky to use.

name: Model 14 "Stalker" Vibrospear
details:
The GM may spend two Threat results from any combat check with this weapon to have it produce a loud noise, spooking nearby animals, alerting foes, and adding two Black Setback dice to the user's next Survival check in that area to hunt or track prey.

The Stalker vibrospear requires two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May spend [TH][TH] from any combat check with this weapon to have it produce a loud noise, spooking nearby animals and adding [SE][SE] to user's next Survival check in this area to hunt or track prey.

description: The "Stalker" is Merr-Sonn Munitions' answer to LaserHone's successful Huntsman Vibrospear.

name: Vibro-Machete
reference: Please see page 43 of the Savage Spirits Sourcebook for details.
description: Produced by manufacturers of vibro tools and weapons such as LaserHone and Merr-Sonn, the vibro-machete is one of the most common vibro-augmented blades on the galactic market.

name: Fusion Cutter
reference: Please see page 197 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook.
description: Fusion cutters are handheld, portable cutting torches found throughout the galaxy in numerous industrial, technical, and artistic operations.

name: Ryyk Blade
details: The damage from the Superior quality is included in the profile.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: The traditional melee weapon of the Wookiees, a Ryyk blade is a heavy, single-edged sword useful for clearing away both brush and enemies in the thick jungles of Kashyyyk.

name: VX "Czerhander" Vibro-Greatsword
details: A vibro-greatsword requires two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

name: Model 7 Therm-Ax
details: A therm-ax requires two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.
description: Though similar in appearance to a vibro-ax, the SoroSuub Model 7 Therm-ax operates on very different principles.

name: Riot Shield
reference: Please see page 42 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: Drearian Defense Conglomerate's Activv1 riot shield is one of the most common models in the galaxy, fielded by officers responding to riots and violent protests.
details: Riot shields can only be used with one-handed weapons, but some incorporate a slot or mag lock to support a Ranged (Heavy) weapon with the shield itself (users fire the weapon one-handed while wielding the riot shield in the other hand). A riot shield with this feature costs an additional 100 credits and has no hard points. Firing a Ranged (Heavy) rifle locked to the shield this way adds a Black Setback die to combat checks with both weapons.

name: Kyuzo War Shield
details:
A Kyuzo war shield may be thrown as a ranged weapon. If used in this manner, change the skill to Ranged - Light and the range of the weapon to short. The weapon also gains the Limited Ammo 1 quality (but if retrieved, it can be used again).

Additionally, the wielder of a Kyuzo war shield may spend three Advantage results from any combat check to throw the weapon to cause the shield to ricochet back to [their] grasp.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: User may spend [AD][AD][AD] from any combat check to throw the weapon to cause the shield to ricochet back to their grasp.

description: Originally utilitarian in function, the Kyuzo war shield was designed by the inhabitants of the Kwaidan Peaks, as a headpiece to protect travelers from torrential rains during monsoon season in southern Phatrong.

name: Thunderbolt Shock Prod
reference: Please see page 43 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: This is a particularly heavy weapon and brutal, mostly used on thick skinned creatures or herd animals. It is often seen as a symbol of an oppressive regime or animal agriculture.

name: Arg'garok
details: The Arg'garok requires two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 103 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: Based on the traditional Gamorrean war ax, the Arg'garok is a massive vibro-ax capable of inflicting horrific wounds.

name: Vibro-Glaive
details: The beastmaster's vibro-glaive requires two hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 103 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: Most often found in the hands of the Weequay, these vibro-glaives consist of a heavy, single-edged head affixed to a pole up to two meters in length.

name: Shistavanen Combat Utility Vibroblade
details: The Combat Utility Vibroblade serves as a Tool Kit to allow Mechanics checks to repair devices and to "heal" droids, but adds a Black Setback die to such checks. Additionally, it adds a Blue Boost die to the character's Survival checks.
reference: Please see page 48 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: The Combat Utility Vibroblade serves as a tool kit to allow Mechanics checks to repair devices and to "heal" droids, but adds [SE] to such checks.
Adds [BO] to the character's Survival checks.

description: The wilds of Uvena Prime can be harsh and unforgiving, and have claimed countless Shistavanen hunters.

name: aKraB Clip-Point Vibrodagger
reference: Please see page 48 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.
description: Diehard survival enthusiasts from Toprawa created the 'aKraB clip-point vibrodagger to slip between the armor plates of big game.

name: Morgukai Cortosis Staff
details: Requires 2 hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 104 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: Used by a cult that fought both Sith and Jedi alike, these staves are built out of a cortosis weave, making them resistant to lightsaber's power. They also use the same sort of plasma weaponry as a lightsaber.

name: Neuronic Whip
details: This weapon can be used to make melee attacks against targets at up to short range (the difficulty remains Average (2 Difficulty)).
reference: Please see page 104 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: Used by slavers across the galaxy to keep their "merchandise" in line, the neuronic whip is a terrible weapon banned from many worlds.

name: Tuskbeast Pike
details: Requires 2 hands to wield.
reference: Please see page 104 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.
description: Originally designed for hunting the giant and mutated tuskbeasts, now that they are extinct, the supply is limited. This is due to the fact that they were traditionally carved from the tusks of the beast.

name: Molecular Stiletto
details: Due to the blade's inherent fragility, any combat check made that generates either two Threat results or a Despair result while wielding one damages the weapon by one step. Add a Black Setback die to a character's Perception check when attempting to find a molecular stiletto on a person's body.
reference: Please see page 43 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SETBACK] to Perception checks to find this weapon on a body.  [THREAT][THREAT] or [DESPAIR] damages weapon by one step.

description: Produced by Xana Exotic Arms, the MSW-9 is a small, easily concealable blade that is popular among professionals, politicians, and entertainers.

name: Stun Baton
reference: Please see page 43 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.
description: Czerka Arms sells "Peacekeeper" stun batons to law enforcement organizations across the galaxy, but they also see substantial sales to private buyers.

name: VL-6 Warhead Launcher System
reference: Please see page 61 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

name: A95 Stingbeam
reference: Please see page 42 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE][SE] to a character's Perception checks to find a stingbeam on a person's body.

description: As small, easy-to-conceal blasters, Stingbeams compete in the microblaster niche market.
details: Add two Black Setback Dice to a character's Perception checks to find a Stingbeam on a person's body.

name: L7 Light Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 43 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE][SE] to Perception checks to notice pistol stashed aboard a starship.

name: 411 Holdout Blaster
reference: Please see page 43 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: These blasters were produced for Imperial agents, having an increased range over other holdouts although with reduced damage. The specifications were stolen and the black market was flooded with the weapon.

name: Model 53 "Quicktrigger" Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 43 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Reduce the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a Model 53 or modify attachments on it by one.

description: Merr-Sonn Munitions' Model 53 "Quicktrigger" blaster pistol is popular across the galactic frontier backwaters thanks to its superior customizability and reliability.
details: Reduce the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a Model 53 or modify attachments on it by one.

name: Model-1 "Nova Viper" Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 43 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Increase difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair or modify attachments by one.

description: The Raider Arms Model-1 "Nova Viper" uses an elegant, long-bodied duelist pistol frame that provides unmatched accuracy.
details: The difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair a Nova Viper or modify attachments on it increases by one.

name: C-10 "Dragoneye Reaper" Heavy Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 43 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: The C-10 "Dragoneye Reaper" features a large, carbine-like frame and barrel nearly identical to those of the SoroSuub "Renegade" Heavy Blaster Pistol and Caliban Model X.

name: "Renegade" Heavy Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 106 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.
description: Occupying a niche similar to that of the BlasTech T-6 "Thunderer" and C-10 "Dragoneye Reaper" Heavy Blaster Pistol, SoroSuub Corporation's "Renegade" heavy blaster pistol features the highest energy output of any SoroSuub-model blaster pistol.

name: GHOVOR-22 Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 47 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.

name: HBt-4 Hunting Blaster
reference: Please see page 44 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: A high-powered rifle for big game hunting, the Herloss HBt-4 hunting blaster is designed for safaris through dense tropical rainforests.

name: VES-700 Pulse Rifle
reference: Please see page 44 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: Often used by urban riot police and bounty hunters, the Corondexx VES-700 pulse rifle has also found a place aboard many of the light freighters roaming the galaxy.

name: Droid Disabler
reference: Please see page 44 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: Produced by Felebreck Electrical Defense Systems, the Droid Disabler is a small but powerful ionization pistol intended to damage, rather than merely incapacitate, droids. Though ineffective at anything but very short ranges, the massive ion blast emitted by a Droid Disabler can permanently fuse the circuits of virtually any unshielded droid, leaving it nothing more than a heap of lifeless scrap. Though devastating to droids and cybernetics, the ion blast doesn’t harm living tissue. Due to the compact size of the energy cell and the large power requirements of the weapon, the Droid Disabler can only be fired a few times before the energy pack needs to be replaced.

name: FWG-5 Flechette Pistol
reference: Please see page 44 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: This flechette pistol from Malaxan Firepower Incorporated utilizes a laser tracking system that guides flechette-filled pellets to targets before exploding in a hail of needle-like debris.

name: 8-Gauge Scatter Gun
reference: Please see page 44 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: Adostic Arms' entry into the civilian home-defense market, the AA8, fires a spray of steel pellets at nearby targets, mowing down home intruders, small predators, and evasive rodents.

name: Ascian Throwing Dagger
reference: Please see page 45 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When attacking, do not increase the difficulty of the check for being engaged.

description: These finely weighted and balanced daggers are designed specifically for throwing, made of durasteel and bearing a mono-molecular edge.

name: Knockout Grenade
reference: Please see page 45 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: No effect on targets wearing breath masks or without respiratory systems.

description: This non-lethal weapon is filled with a tranquilizer gas that rapidly subdues most living things within the blast radius.

name: Cryoban Projector
reference: Please see page 45 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Can be used to fight fires. Add [BO] to attempts to put out a fire.  Assisted checks add [BO] per character with a Cryoban Projector.

description: CryoBan projectors like TaggeCo.'s spew a mix of chemicals that create areas of intense cold.
details: A character armed with a CryoBan projector adds a Blue Boost Die die to attempts to put out a fire. Assisted checks to extinguish flames add one additional Blue Boost Die for each assissting character equipped with a CryoBan projector.

name: SSB-1 Static Pistol
reference: Please see page 45 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: Originally developed by the long defunct Systech Corporation several thousand years ago, the old design was recently revived by SoroSuub as the SSB-1 static blaster pistol.

name: Shock Boots
reference: Please see page 45 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE] to a Perception checks to notice they are a weapon.

description: A specialty item crafted for those determined not to be caught defenseless under any circumstances, shock boots use the same technology as Shock Gloves.
details: Shock boots are worn on the feet, and thus do not require a hand to wield. Add a Black Setback die to a character's Perception checks to notice that shock boots are a weapon rather than normal footwear.

name: Punch Dagger
reference: Please see page 46 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Add [SE][SE] to Perception checks to find on a person's body.

description: This small and short knife is gripped in such a way that the blade protrudes between one's fingers of a clenched fist. It is unassuming enough that it is often not caught at security checkpoints.

name: Blade-Breaker
reference: Please see page 46 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: A blade-breaker is wielded in the off hand as a parry blade in conjunction with a vibrosword or other Melee Weapon, though some warriors carry a pair of blade-breakers into combat.

name: Vibrorapier
reference: Please see page 46 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.
description: A long, light, slender-bladed vibrosword, a vibrorapier is extremely well-balanced and suited for professional artists of the blade.

name: Heavy Proton Torpedo Launcher
reference: Please see page 119 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

name: Ion Thruster Gun
reference: Please see page 45 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.
description: Ion thrusters are used in many different engines, from those of airspeeders to the drives of grand starships.
details:
=== CUSTOM ATTACHMENT ===
'''Shaped Nozzle:''' By adding a metal cone to an ion thruster, a Technician can dramatically increase its potency as a weapon, focusing the energy into a sharp beam rather than letting it disperse in a wide arc.

name: Multi-Goo Gun
reference: Please see page 45 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Gain automatic [AD] on [B]Mechanics checks[b] to repair droids, vehicles, or starships.

description: The multi-goo gun, an all-in-one spray injector, has a self-cleaning element that allows Technicians to switch out lubricant, adhesive, or acid cartridges with no loss in function.
details:
A character using this tool gains an automatic Advantage result on Mechanics checks to repair droids, vehicles, or starships.

The GM may spend two Threat results or a Despair result on a Mechanics or combat check made using a multi-goo gun to have all of its spray cartridges run out; it cannot be used at all until refilled. A pack that includes replacements for all three substances costs 20 credits and has a rarity of 2. Placing a refill pack in a multi-goo gun requires an action.

name: Repulsor Gun
reference: Please see page 46 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Gain automatic [AD] on [B]Mechanics checks[b] to repair droids, vehicles, or starships.
[TH][TH] or [DE] on a Mechanics or Combat check may be spent to have all of its spray cartridges to run out.

description: Little more than toys for bored technicians, repulsor guns are makeshift devices crafted from a small repulsor engine, a charge capacitor, and a trigger assembly.
details: On a Despair result, the repulsor gun backfires: the user is knocked prone and suffers the disoriented status effect for two rounds.

name: Rivet Gun
reference: Please see page 46 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: A rivet gun reduces the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair Critical Hits on vehicles and starships by 1.

description: Most rivet guns work around the principle of a basic pneumatic hammer, and fire bolts into vehicle plating.
details: A rivet gun reduces the difficulty of Mechanics checks to repair Critical Hits on vehicles and starships by 1. By switching out the standard single-bolt loading system for a cobbled-together "magazine" containing numerous bolts, a skilled craftsperson can increase the number of rivets the gun can place per minute dramatically.

name: Hand Grinder
reference: Please see page 47 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Hand grinders add automatic [AD] to crafting checks that involve shaping large pieces of hardened material.

description: A hand grinder uses a rotating wheel coated with rough material to polish down spurs and marks on metal surfaces.
details: A hand grinder adds an automatic advantage result to crafting checks that involve shaping large pieces of hardened material. A hand grinder requires two hands to use as a weapon.

name: Welding Rod
reference: Please see page 47 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Welding rods add automatic [AD] to Mechanics checks to repair droids, vehicles, and starships.
[DE] may be used to inflict a Critical Injury on user.

description: Technicians need not only the ability to cut metal apart quickly, but the capacity to fuse it back together.
details:
A welding rod adds an automatic Success result to Mechanics checks to repair droids, vehicles, and starships.

The GM may spend a Despair result on any check made with a welding rod to inflict a Critical Injury on the user.

name: Mass-Driver Cannon
reference: Please see page 57 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

name: 1.8 FD Anti-Infantry Autoturret
reference: Please see page 45 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: While attached to a suitable power source (such as a base's power grid or a similarly-sized generator), this wweapon loses the Limited Ammo 8 quality. Wiring the weapon into a power source requires several minutes and an [B]Easy ([DI]) Mechanics check[b].

description: Atgar SpaceDefense has been a major developer of weaponry for some time, but in recent years, its prominence on the battlefield has diminished.
details: While attached to a suitable power source (such as a base's power grid or a similarly-sized generator), this weapon loses the Limited Ammo 8 quality. Wiring the weapon into a power source requires several minutes and an Easy (1 Difficulty) Check.

name: Anti-Air Rockets
reference: Please see page 62 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

name: Anti-Personnel Laser
reference: Please see page 62 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

name: BR-219 Heavy Blaster Pistol
reference: Please see page 40 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: GM may spend [TH][TH] to damage weapon one step.
GM may spend [DE] to cause weapon to meltdown and expload, destroying weapon and causing base damage to wielder.

description: One of the most lethal blaster pistols on the market, BlasTech's BR-219 is only available directly from the factory, and requires an intense ISB background check.
details: GMs may spend two Threat to damage the BR-219 one step. In addition, Game Masters may spend one Despair to cause the BR-219 to melt down and explored, destroying the weapon and dealing base weapon damage to the user.

name: GLX Firelance
reference: Please see page 40 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.
description: Developed during the Clone Wars, the GLX Firelance is a compact blaster rifle marketed to "freelance law enforcement agents."

name: LD-1 Target Rifle
reference: Please see page 40 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.
description: Merr-Sonn's LD-1 is the company's latest foray into the highly competitive long-range blaster market.

name: SSG Mk II Paladin
reference: Please see page 41 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

name: KWS Mk I Saberdart
reference: Please see page 41 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May be loaded with 1 dose of synthetic neuroparalytic or any other poison.  Whenever wielder successfully attacks a target, even if no damage is dealt, the target suffers the effects of the poison.

description: Kaminoan Weaponsmiths, a subsidiary of Kaminoan Armorsmiths Lts., is a small weapons producer based on the water planet of Kamino.
details: Saberdarts may be loaded with 1 dose of Synthetic Neuroparalytic, or any other poison the GM deems appropriate. Whenever the wielder successfully attacks a target with the weapon (even if [they] deal no damage), the target also suffers the effects of being exposed to the poison.

name: NX-14 Needler
reference: Please see page 42 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Removes all [SE] added by a personal deflector shield.
Adds [SE] to Perception checks to find a concealed needler on an individual.

description: "Needlers" refer to an obscure series of dart shooters that rely on electromagnetic rail propulsion.
details: A needler removes all Black Setback dice added by a personal deflector shield. Anyone searching an individual carrying a concealed needler adds one Black Setback die to their Perception check to find the weapon.

name: Crossguard Lightsaber
reference: Please see page 42 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] on enemy Melee or Lightsaber check to disarm enemy.

description: Crossguard lightsabers were once common among Makashi Duelists, many of whom fought at the Great Scourge of Malachor.
details:
Whenever an enemy engaged with a character armed with a crossguard lightsaber makes a Melee or Lightsaber check, after the attack is resolved, the character may spend three Threat results or a Despair result to hook their opponent's blade and disarm them. Aside from losing the weapon, any other effects of being disarmed are left to the GM's discretion. 

This lightsaber is a Crossguard Lightsaber Hilt containing an unmodded Ilum Crystal. This crystal occupies two of the weapon's hard points.

name: Lightwhip
reference: Please see page 42 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May spend [AD][AD] or [TR] to prevent opponent from using Parry to reduce damage.

description: Highly modified lightsabers, lightwhips consist of a short lightsaber haft built from alloys or composites laced either cortosis, phrik alloy, or a comparable energy-resistant alloy.
details: When the wielder makes a successful Lightsaber combat check, they may spend two Advantage results or a Triumph result to prevent their opponent from using the Parry talent incidental to reduce damage. A user may not add lightsaber crystal attachments to a lightwhip and cannot use a lightwhip to parry or reflect attacks. This weapon can be used to make melee attacks against targets up to short range (the difficulty remains Average (2 Difficulty))

name: Philaxian Phase-Knife
reference: Please see page 43 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When used with the Saber Throw talent, may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] instead of [FP] to have phase-knife return to the wielder's hand.

description: Developed by an obscure cadre of artificers, these blades were once popular on Philaxia before its discovery by the Republic.
details: When used with the Saber Throw talent, a character may spend two Advantage results or a Triumph result (instead of a Light Force Point or a Dark Force Point) to have the phase-knife return to their hand. A user may not add lightsaber crystal attachments to a phase-knife. Anyone searching a character carrying a deactivated phase-knife adds a Black Setback die to the Perception check to find the weapon.

name: Crossguard Lightsaber Hilt
reference: Please see page 43 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: May spend [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] on enemy Melee or Lightsaber check to disarm enemy.

details: [A lightsaber hilt] requires a Kyber Crystals to become a true weapon (otherwise they deal no damage, have no critical rating, and do not have many of their item qualities).

name: Concussion Mine
reference: Please see page 64 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

name: Connor Net Mine
reference: Please see page 64 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

name: Firecracker Mine
reference: Please see page 64 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When a vessel is struck by a firecracker mine, each occupant is disoriented for three rounds.

name: Gravity Mine
reference: Please see page 64 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Creates a gravitic bubble, preventing all ships within long range from entering hyperspace.

name: Ion Mine
reference: Please see page 64 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

name: Seeker Mine
reference: Please see page 64 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Character who set mine can spend [TH][TH] from target pilot's [B]Piloting (Space) check[b] to force the pilot to repeat the check at one less difficulty.

name: "Precision-X" Marksman Rifle
reference: Please see page 44 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: When set to stun, range changes to medium.

description: Cadregg Armory's first entry into the civilian sporting-rfile market, the "Precision-X" is coveted by competition shooters, military snipers, and blaster enthusiasts alike.
details: When this weapon's Stun Setting is used to deal Stun damage, its range changes from long to medium (and cannot be increased).

name: "Subduer-9" Riot Blaster
reference: Please see page 44 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: SoroSuub's "Subduer-9" riot blaster is one of the most common law enforcement scatter blasters in the galaxy.

name: "Firecaller" Light Flame Projector
reference: Please see page 44 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Packing the devastation of a flame projector into the compact frame of a pistol, Merr-Sonn's "Firecaller" light flame projector is banned throughout most of civilized space.

name: Grapnel-Harpoon Launcher
reference: Please see page 45 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: As an action, make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check[b] to secure hook to an object within medium range.
Once secured, the cord may be reeled in as an action.
To pull another character aloft, must succeed in an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Athletics check[b].

description: Commonly thought of as tools for climbing or lifting cargo, the weapons division of Pharr Co. instead produces grapnel launchers with the balance and targeting capabilities necessary for combat use, allowing their users to entangle opponents in a binding cord.
details: In addition to the grapnel-harpoon launcher's capabilities as a weapon, as an action, a character may make an Average (2 Difficulty) Ranged - Light Check to secure the grappling hook to an object within medium range. On success, as an action, [they] may reel in the cord, pulling [themselves] to the object (or, if the object is unsecured and lighter than [they] are, pulling it to [them]). A character may use the grappling hook to pull another character aloft with [them]; if [they] do, [they] must make an Average (2 Difficulty) Athletics Check to avoid losing [their] grip on either [their] partner or the launcher.

name: "Impact" Repulsor Cannon
reference: Please see page 45 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Inspired by makeshift repulsor guns, Nova Design created the "Impact" repulsor cannon as an attempt at weaponizing repulsor technology.

name: Anti-Armor Micro-Rocket
reference: Please see page 46 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Anti-armor micro-rockets feature a small shaped charge that detonates on contact.

name: Explosive Micro-Rocket
reference: Please see page 46 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Explosive micro-rockets rely on a chepatite impact explosive to deliver a powerful kinetic blast of energy on impact.

name: Flechette Micro-Rocket
reference: Please see page 46 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Micro-rockets with flechette payloads are packed with razor-sharp needles that can tear through unarmored targets.

name: Incendiary Micro-Rocket
reference: Please see page 46 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Micro-rockets with incendiary payloads explode in flames, using a mixture of chemicals that burn very hot and slow enough to ensure they spread to anything flammable nearby.

name: Ion Micro-Rocket
reference: Please see page 47 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: The ion micro-rocket employs an ion-pulse warhead that disrupts electronic equipment within its blast radius.
details: An ion micro-rocket's Sunder quality can only be activated to damage powered equipment, such as sensors, blasters, and vibroblades. It cannot be used to damage items that operate without power, as they have no circuitry to disrupt.

name: "Peacekeeper" Stun Baton
reference: Please see page 48 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Czerka Arms sells "Peacekeeper" stun batons to law enforcement organizations across the galaxy, but they also see substantial sales to private buyers.

name: Ion Pike
reference: Please see page 48 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.
description: Used to incapacitate escaped or malfunctioning droids, these slender lengths of metal are flexible enough to slip between armor plating to reach vulnerable power sources and circuit banks, where they release a powerful ion charge.

name: Micro-Rocket Launcher Pistol
reference: Please see page 47 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

base_mods.misc_desc: Up to three micro-rockets can be loaded into the launcher.  Use the fired rocket's profile, but the launcher's range, if longer.

description: While micro-rockets are most often mounted on armor or on other weapons like blaster rifles, there are weapon frames that only fire micro-rockets.
details:
While a Micro-Rocket is loaded, it replaces the damage, critical rating, and item qualities of the launcher. 

Up to 3 micro-rockets can be loaded in the launcher. While a micro-rocket is loaded, it replaces the damage, critical rating, and item qualities of the launcher.
